item.title: Average US long-term mortgage rate rises again, inching up to 6.24%
item.description: The average rate on a 30-year U.S. mortgage edged higher for the second week in a row, hovering near its low point so far this year

item.title: Families of two babies sickened by infantile botulism sue ByHeart over recalled formula
item.description: The parents of two babies who were sickened in an infantile botulism outbreak linked to recalled ByHeart infant formula are suing the company

item.title: Airlines are optimistic about a quick recovery ahead of Thanksgiving once FAA ends flight cuts
item.description: Airlines are optimistic they can resume normal operations within a few days once the government lifts its order to cut some flights at 40 busy airport...

item.title: Workers take on side jobs to combat stagnant salaries and insecurity about employment
item.description: Working professionals in the U.S. are taking on side jobs to supplement their incomes amid frozen salaries, inflation and fear of layoffs

item.title: The unprecedented government shutdown will weigh on a US economy already under stress
item.description: The six-week government shutdown that came to an end late Wednesday will be another drag on an economy already facing many challenges, though the full...
